Authors:
Franciszek Wojciech Kornobis, Solomija Susulovska, Andrij
Susulovsky, Sergei A Subbotin
Title:
Morphological and molecular characterisation of
Paralongidorus rex AndrÃ¡ssy, 1986 (Nematoda: Longidoridae) from Poland
and Ukraine
Keywords:
Paralongidorus rex, morphometrics, D2-D3, ITS1, 18S,
RFLP
Abstract:
Paralongidorus rex populations were found for the first
time in Poland and Ukraine. This paper describes females and juveniles
from four of those populations on the basis of morphology and
morphometrics and provides molecular characterization of this species
using 18S, ITS1 and D2-D3 expansion segments of 28S rRNA gene sequences.
Morphometrically, females differed mainly in V ratio (in four
populations 41.9 (38.6 â 44.3), 42.7 (41.6 â 44.0), 46.1 (43.9 â 48.0),
46.8(44.6 - 51)) and odontostylet length (166.6 (163 - 172), 170.6 (161
- 180), 191.5 (182 â 198), 193.2 (180 - 206) Âµm). Phylogenetic analysis
showed Paralongidorus rex has a sister relationship with P. iranicus.
PCR-D2-D3 of 28S-RFLP diagnostic profiles with five enzymes are given.
Additionally, information on new host plants and map of distribution for
Paralongidorus rex are provided. Based on comparaison of obtained D2-D3
expansion segemnts of 28S rRNA new record of this nematode species from
Slovakia is given. Finally, remarks on the potential importance of this
species in grapevine production are given.
